channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: COCO-O: A Benchmark for Object Detectors under Natural Distribution Shifts
item.description: To give a more comprehensive robustness assessment, we introduce COCO-O(ut-of-distribution), a test dataset based on COCO with 6 types of natural distribution shifts.

item.title: Rethinking Medical Report Generation: Disease Revealing Enhancement with Knowledge Graph
item.description: Knowledge Graph (KG) plays a crucial role in Medical Report Generation (MRG) because it reveals the relations among diseases and thus can be utilized to guide the generation process.

item.title: Exposing the Troublemakers in Described Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we advance them to a more practical setting called Described Object Detection (DOD) by expanding category names to flexible language expressions for OVD and overcoming the limitation of REC to only grounding the pre-existing object.

item.title: Multi-View Vertebra Localization and Identification from CT Images
item.description: Additionally, we further propose a Sequence Loss to maintain the sequential structure embedded along the vertebrae.

item.title: Unbiased Delayed Feedback Label Correction for Conversion Rate Prediction
item.description: To directly introduce the correct feedback label information, we propose an Unbiased delayed feedback Label Correction framework (ULC), which uses an auxiliary model to correct labels for observed negative feedback samples.

item.title: SwinMM: Masked Multi-view with Swin Transformers for 3D Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: To address this limitation, we present Masked Multi-view with Swin Transformers (SwinMM), a novel multi-view pipeline for enabling accurate and data-efficient self-supervised medical image analysis.

item.title: Concept-based explainability for an EEG transformer model
item.description: Deep learning models are complex due to their size, structure, and inherent randomness in training procedures.

item.title: Client-Level Differential Privacy via Adaptive Intermediary in Federated Medical Imaging
item.description: In this paper, we propose to optimize the trade-off under the context of client-level DP, which focuses on privacy during communications.

item.title: Aligning Large Language Models with Human: A Survey
item.description: (2) Training methodologies: a detailed review of the prevailing training methods employed for LLM alignment.

item.title: Continuation Path Learning for Homotopy Optimization
item.description: Homotopy optimization is a traditional method to deal with a complicated optimization problem by solving a sequence of easy-to-hard surrogate subproblems.

item.title: Boosting Punctuation Restoration with Data Generation and Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Punctuation restoration is an important task in automatic speech recognition (ASR) which aim to restore the syntactic structure of generated ASR texts to improve readability.

item.title: A Statistical View of Column Subset Selection
item.description: We consider the problem of selecting a small subset of representative variables from a large dataset.

item.title: Hierarchical Skeleton Meta-Prototype Contrastive Learning with Hard Skeleton Mining for Unsupervised Person Re-Identification
item.description: Then a hierarchical meta-prototype contrastive learning model is proposed to cluster and contrast the most typical skeleton features ("prototypes") from different-level skeletons.

item.title: Rule By Example: Harnessing Logical Rules for Explainable Hate Speech Detection
item.description: In this paper, we present Rule By Example (RBE): a novel exemplar-based contrastive learning approach for learning from logical rules for the task of textual content moderation.

item.title: Compact & Capable: Harnessing Graph Neural Networks and Edge Convolution for Medical Image Classification
item.description: In this study, we investigate the potential of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) for medical image classification.

item.title: GridMM: Grid Memory Map for Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: Vision-and-language navigation (VLN) enables the agent to navigate to a remote location following the natural language instruction in 3D environments.

item.title: Addressing the Impact of Localized Training Data in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: To tackle the challenges posed by localized training data, we approach the problem as an out-of-distribution (OOD) data issue by by aligning the distributions between the training data, which represents a small portion of labeled data, and the graph inference process that involves making predictions for the entire graph.

item.title: PG-RCNN: Semantic Surface Point Generation for 3D Object Detection
item.description: Motivated by this, we propose Point Generation R-CNN (PG-RCNN), a novel end-to-end detector that generates semantic surface points of foreground objects for accurate detection.

item.title: Remote Bio-Sensing: Open Source Benchmark Framework for Fair Evaluation of rPPG
item.description: Remote Photoplethysmography (rPPG) is a technology that utilizes the light absorption properties of hemoglobin, captured via camera, to analyze and measure blood volume pulse (BVP).

item.title: Treatment Outcome Prediction for Intracerebral Hemorrhage via Generative Prognostic Model with Imaging and Tabular Data
item.description: Specifically, we propose to employ a variational autoencoder model to generate a low-dimensional prognostic score, which can effectively address the selection bias resulting from the non-randomized controlled trials.

item.title: An Empirical Evaluation of Temporal Graph Benchmark
item.description: In this paper, we conduct an empirical evaluation of Temporal Graph Benchmark (TGB) by extending our Dynamic Graph Library (DyGLib) to TGB.

item.title: Guidance in Radiology Report Summarization: An Empirical Evaluation and Error Analysis
item.description: Automatically summarizing radiology reports into a concise impression can reduce the manual burden of clinicians and improve the consistency of reporting.

item.title: A Connection between One-Step Regularization and Critic Regularization in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: One-step methods perform regularization by doing just a single step of policy improvement, while critic regularization methods do many steps of policy improvement with a regularized objective.

item.title: PRIOR: Prototype Representation Joint Learning from Medical Images and Reports
item.description: In this paper, we present a prototype representation learning framework incorporating both global and local alignment between medical images and reports.

item.title: Online Continual Learning in Keyword Spotting for Low-Resource Devices via Pooling High-Order Temporal Statistics
item.description: Keyword Spotting (KWS) models on embedded devices should adapt fast to new user-defined words without forgetting previous ones.

item.title: Nonparametric Linear Feature Learning in Regression Through Regularisation
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose a novel method for linear feature learning with non-parametric prediction, which simultaneously estimates the prediction function and the linear subspace.

item.title: A Theoretically Guaranteed Quaternion Weighted Schatten p-norm Minimization Method for Color Image Restoration
item.description: Very recently, a quaternion-based WNNM approach (QWNNM) has been developed to mitigate this issue, which is capable of representing the color image as a whole in the quaternion domain and preserving the inherent correlation among the three color channels.

item.title: Causal Fair Machine Learning via Rank-Preserving Interventional Distributions
item.description: A decision can be defined as fair if equal individuals are treated equally and unequals unequally.

item.title: COCO-O: A Benchmark for Object Detectors under Natural Distribution Shifts
item.description: To give a more comprehensive robustness assessment, we introduce COCO-O(ut-of-distribution), a test dataset based on COCO with 6 types of natural distribution shifts.

item.title: Lost In Translation: Generating Adversarial Examples Robust to Round-Trip Translation
item.description: Language Models today provide a high accuracy across a large number of downstream tasks.

item.title: Less is More: Focus Attention for Efficient DETR
item.description: DETR-like models have significantly boosted the performance of detectors and even outperformed classical convolutional models.

item.title: LiDAR Meta Depth Completion
item.description: While using a single model, our method yields significantly better results than a non-adaptive baseline trained on different LiDAR patterns.

item.title: TF-ICON: Diffusion-Based Training-Free Cross-Domain Image Composition
item.description: In this paper, we propose TF-ICON, a novel Training-Free Image COmpositioN framework that harnesses the power of text-driven diffusion models for cross-domain image-guided composition.

item.title: FDCT: Fast Depth Completion for Transparent Objects
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose a Fast Depth Completion framework for Transparent objects (FDCT), which also benefits downstream tasks like object pose estimation.

item.title: A Generalized Schwarz-type Non-overlapping Domain Decomposition Method using Physics-constrained Neural Networks
item.description: To ensure the consistency of solutions across neighboring subdomains, we adopt a generalized Robin-type interface condition, assigning unique Robin parameters to each subdomain.

item.title: Building Extraction from Remote Sensing Images via an Uncertainty-Aware Network
item.description: Building extraction aims to segment building pixels from remote sensing images and plays an essential role in many applications, such as city planning and urban dynamic monitoring.

item.title: ResShift: Efficient Diffusion Model for Image Super-resolution by Residual Shifting
item.description: Diffusion-based image super-resolution (SR) methods are mainly limited by the low inference speed due to the requirements of hundreds or even thousands of sampling steps.

item.title: EchoGLAD: Hierarchical Graph Neural Networks for Left Ventricle Landmark Detection on Echocardiograms
item.description: To address this challenge, we introduce an echocardiogram-based, hierarchical graph neural network (GNN) for left ventricle landmark detection (EchoGLAD).

item.title: RANSAC-NN: Unsupervised Image Outlier Detection using RANSAC
item.description: Image outlier detection (OD) is crucial for ensuring the quality and accuracy of image datasets used in computer vision tasks.

item.title: Expediting Building Footprint Segmentation from High-resolution Remote Sensing Images via progressive lenient supervision
item.description: The efficacy of building footprint segmentation from remotely sensed images has been hindered by model transfer effectiveness.

item.title: Milimili. Collecting Parallel Data via Crowdsourcing
item.description: We present a methodology for gathering a parallel corpus through crowdsourcing, which is more cost-effective than hiring professional translators, albeit at the expense of quality.

item.title: DiAMoNDBack: Diffusion-denoising Autoregressive Model for Non-Deterministic Backmapping of CÎ± Protein Traces
item.description: The autoregressive generation process proceeds from the protein N-terminus to C-terminus in a residue-by-residue fashion conditioned on the C{\alpha} trace and previously backmapped backbone and side chain atoms within the local neighborhood.

item.title: Towards Generic and Controllable Attacks Against Object Detection
item.description: To this end, we propose a generic white-box attack, LGP (local perturbations with adaptively global attacks), to blind mainstream object detectors with controllable perturbations.

item.title: DeepCL: Deep Change Feature Learning on Remote Sensing Images in the Metric Space
item.description: To address these issues, we complement the strong temporal modeling ability of metric learning with the prominent fitting ability of segmentation and propose a deep change feature learning (DeepCL) framework for robust and explainable CD.

item.title: DQ-Det: Learning Dynamic Query Combinations for Transformer-based Object Detection and Segmentation
item.description: Transformer-based detection and segmentation methods use a list of learned detection queries to retrieve information from the transformer network and learn to predict the location and category of one specific object from each query.

item.title: Right for the Wrong Reason: Can Interpretable ML Techniques Detect Spurious Correlations?
item.description: Such dependencies on confounding information can be difficult to detect using performance metrics if the test data comes from the same distribution as the training data.

item.title: Learning Navigational Visual Representations with Semantic Map Supervision
item.description: Being able to perceive the semantics and the spatial structure of the environment is essential for visual navigation of a household robot.

item.title: Iterative Robust Visual Grounding with Masked Reference based Centerpoint Supervision
item.description: The proposed framework is evaluated on five regular VG datasets and two newly constructed robust VG datasets.

item.title: On the Effectiveness of Offline RL for Dialogue Response Generation
item.description: A common training technique for language models is teacher forcing (TF).

item.title: FATRER: Full-Attention Topic Regularizer for Accurate and Robust Conversational Emotion Recognition
item.description: This paper concentrates on the understanding of interlocutors' emotions evoked in conversational utterances.
